title: Moka pot
summary: The moka pot is a stove-top or electric coffee maker that brews coffee by passing boiling water pressurised by steam through ground coffee. Named after the Yemeni city of Mocha, it was invented by Italian engineer Alfonso Bialetti in 1933 and quickly became one of the staples of Italian culture.[1][2] Bialetti Industries continues to produce the same model under the trade name "Moka Express".
